blog.name: daybreak96
blog.title: Now is the Hour of Wolves
blog.description: Never cruel or cowardly. Never give up. Never give in. My fanfics - Fic Rec's - A collection of Seb's (and some of Chris's) photoshoots

summary: OK, I’m posting this cos I haven’t seen it on my timeline cos of the Seb overload I’ve been swimming in this weekend, but Mark...
caption: OK, I’m posting this cos I haven’t seen it on my timeline cos of the Seb overload I’ve been swimming in this weekend, but Mark Ruffalo posted this on his Twitter yesterday and I can’t get over how much this looks like a deleted scene!!

blog.name: afictionaladventure16
blog.title: "Who the hell is Bucky?"
blog.description: ALL REQUESTS CLOSED! I mostly write Marvel Teen!reader imagines and fics! Check out my Masterlist to see what else I write! @iconsfire for the amazing header photo and icon!

tags: chris evans teen reader one shot
summary: Okay but like.... Teen!reader having depression. She is a (semi) productive person when she's going through the worse parts, but...
question: Okay but like.... Teen!reader having depression. She is a (semi) productive person when she's going through the worse parts, but only focuses on work and not relationships. Chris Evans is a worried dad figure and tries his best to help. Just lots of fluff from our softest non-dad dad
answer:
I’ll Rise Like the Day (Chris Evans x Teen!Reader)

Actor Fics Masterlist

Want to be in a Character Taglist?

Song Title: Rise Up by Andra Day

Warnings: Mentions of depression, worthlessness, and fluff

Word Count: 862



You were bound to have your bad days.

“(Y/N), hon, we’re gonna need some more energy from you,” you heard one of the Russo brothers yell, as you finished your stunt. You let out a sigh, trying to compose yourself.

It’s okay to have a bad day.

“Let’s try it again,” Anthony called out.

It’s just a bad day, not a bad life.

“And Action!” You attempted your stunt once more, cursing to yourself when you landed on your feet, you knew it wasn’t the energy they were looking for. “Alright, let’s call it a day,” Anthony announced.

Joe walked up to you, “don’t feel too bad about it, kid,” he reassured, “you had a long day, many stunts, we could all use some sleep and a day off.”

You gave Joe a nod, making your way over to the make-up trailer. The people helped you take off the make-up and then your costume. You felt like a thousand pounds had been lifted off of you once your costume was off.

But the bad days were always the worst days. They made you feel worthless and you felt like you couldn’t do anything right.

You walked into your trailer, heading straight to your bed. All you wanted to do was lay in bed and sleep. Sleepaway all the numbness away. It what you thought could cure the feeling inside of you, but you always had to wake up back to that feeling and you hated it. There were times you found yourself waking up with tears because of just the fact that you woke up made you feel sad.

You let out a sigh as you covered your body with your favorite blanket. No teenager should feel this way.

You heard your phone vibrate on the nightstand, you grabbed it, you squinted your eyes to adjust to the screen brightness.

Hey, me and Harrison and some other friends are going bowling. Want to join?

You sighed at the message from Tom, you wanted to go but at the same time, you just wanted to stay in bed. But you knew, a teenager needed to have fun but it’s no fun having fun when all you want to do is be alone in your bed and sleep. That’s all you wanted to do was sleep. Most of your energy was spent on set, you didn’t think you had enough left to spend it with friends.

No thanks

You replied, placing your phone back on the nightstand, you soon drifted off to sleep.

It was everyone’s day off and usually you and Chris would grab breakfast, but when you didn’t show up to his trailer or text or call him, he began to worry. He pulled on his shoes and walked out of his trailer, it was already 9 in the morning, everyone had left to go roam around the city. He made his way over to your trailer, knocking softly on the door, getting no answer. “(Y/N)? You in there?” Chris opened the door, “kid?” He called out, “are you still asleep?” he chuckled as he closed the door behind him, “it’s almost  lunchtime and we still haven’t had breakfast.”

Chris made his way over to your small bedroom area, it was quite a mess, “Geez,” he said quietly at the mess, “come on, (Y/N), wake up,” he shook you slightly. Your eye fluttered open, you felt your breath hitch.

Tears began to well in your eyes, “go away,” you hissed as you covered your face with your covers.

Chris was starting to put two and two together, he sighed and began cleaning up a bit. He knew about your bad days, your parents have mentioned it before. He had promised to take care of you on set since your parents still had to work and they couldn’t really be there. Chris assured them that he would keep a watchful eye on you and soon he became like a second father to you. He was torn at the sight, he hated seeing people so young going through a battle they just couldn’t see. Once he finished cleaning up, he sat back down beside you on the bed, combing your hair with his hands. He knew you were awake, he could hear you sniffling, “the best way to beat this is by showing it that it can’t control you.”

“It’s hard, Chris,” you sobbed out, “it’s like it’s pinning me down.”

“I know, hon, but you have to get up, even if it’s just to move to the couch. Just getting out a bed is a huge success,” He encouraged. “Come on, we can watch Disney movies and order some take-out, how does that sound?” You slowly sat up in your bed, he frowned at the sight of your puffy eyes. Chris wiped your tear stained cheeks with his sleeve, “that’s my girl,” he said softly.

You wrapped your arms around his waist, “thank you, Dorito,” Chris chuckled at the nickname.

“Come on, kid, let’s get you to the couch,” Chris helped you to the couch. It was okay to have bad days, you just had to work through them. Slowly and gently. With people who cared about you and who were willing to be patient, who were willing to let you show your emotions without saying a word. Because bad days will pass, just like the good days, it’s all part of being human after all.





Permanent Taglist: @otomefan @dejaazaro @culturebay @kpopishilarious @fireproof-heaven @iloveyouthreethousand-o6  @weappreciatepower @whereyoustand  @white-wolf-buckaroo @spider-woman22 @coffee-habit @supernaturallover2002 @barnes-parker @therealmrshale @myinternetissoslow @myhippiehopes @benhardyswifeee @celyndavies @xzowiex @ximaginx @wooshytooshy @unapologeticallymimi   @glitterquadricorn @lady-of-lies  @cassmoreiraxo @just4muggles @mellorine-paprika  @agirlruinedbybands @yougottalovefandoms @avngrsinitiative @lizlil

tags: a pastry chef attempts to make gourmet doritos
summary: I’m watching a video called “Pastry Chef Attempts to Make Gourmet Doritos.” The video is like 45 minutes long because apparently...
body:
I’m watching a video called “Pastry Chef Attempts to Make Gourmet Doritos.” The video is like 45 minutes long because apparently this is a really difficult process. 

I want to know why she didn’t just contact Chris Evans/his parents. They clearly knew how to make a Gourmet Dorito.

tags: Im glad hes enjoying his day
hes always having a good time
what the heck is he doing

summary: “It's so funny; I woke up this morning, and Not Another Teen Movie was on TV. I don't know if you ever saw it, but I had to put...
body:
“It’s so funny; I woke up this morning, and Not Another Teen Movie was on TV. I don’t know if you ever saw it, but I had to put a banana in my butt. At the time, you’re just so happy to be on a job. I just looked at it and said, ‘Who cares? I’m earning my stripes.” -Chris Evans

(Vid)
